label.INDWORRYAC: Percentage of people very worried about (all types) of crime

result.label: Indicator - Worry about crime
note:
[b]Worry about crime 

[/b] [b]How do we measure this?[/b] 
Percentage of people who, when thinking about all types of crime in general, are very worried about being a victim of crime.

[b]Source[/b] 
Findings from the 2022/23 Northern Ireland Safe Community Telephone Survey 
[url=https://www.justice-ni.gov.uk/publications/r-s-bulletin-findings-202223-northern-ireland-safe-community-telephone-survey]R & S Bulletin Findings from the 2022/23 Northern Ireland Safe Community Telephone Survey | Department of Justice (justice-ni.gov.uk)[/url] 

[b]Impact of Covid-19[/b]
There was a change in survey mode from 2020/21 due to the pandemic and the method by which interviews were undertaken changed from face-to-face to telephone. This resulted in a break in the time series. The change reduced the sample size, particularly for 2020/21. Results for the three latest years are not directly comparable with previous sweeps.

[b]Further information[/b] 
1. The Northern Ireland Safe Community Survey was previously known as the NI Crime Survey. Given the change in survey mode as a result of the pandemic, the survey years from 2020/21 are referenced as the Northern Ireland Safe Community Telephone Survey. 
2. Previously conducted on an ad hoc basis, the survey began operating on a continuous basis in January 2005. 
3. Results exclude don't knows and refusals.
